segment.source: Troubleshooting MED-V
segment.target: Troubleshooting MED-V

segment.source: Troubleshooting MED-V
segment.target: Troubleshooting MED-V

segment.source: Troubleshooting MED-V
segment.target: Troubleshooting MED-V

segment.source: This section provides information to help troubleshoot general issues with Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V).
segment.target: This section provides information to help troubleshoot general issues with Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V).

segment.source: Changing the host resolution and then maximizing the MED-V workspace causes the desktop to appear black
segment.target: Changing the host resolution and then maximizing the MED-V workspace causes the desktop to appear black

segment.source: When working in full desktop mode, if you change the host resolution and then maximize the MED-V workspace window, the desktop appears black and the MED-V workspace might not respond.
segment.target: When working in full desktop mode, if you change the host resolution and then maximize the MED-V workspace window, the desktop appears black and the MED-V workspace might not respond.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Stop and then start the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Stop and then start the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Starting a MED-V workspace with a network adapter disabled and then later enabling the adapter does not restore network connectivity
segment.target: Starting a MED-V workspace with a network adapter disabled and then later enabling the adapter does not restore network connectivity

segment.source: If you configure a MED-V workspace in bridge mode and then start the MED-V workspace while a network adapter is disabled, if the adapter is later enabled, the network connectivity through that adapter is not restored.
segment.target: If you configure a MED-V workspace in bridge mode and then start the MED-V workspace while a network adapter is disabled, if the adapter is later enabled, the network connectivity through that adapter is not restored.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Stop and then start the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Stop and then start the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: An image can be used by only one Windows user per computer
segment.target: An image can be used by only one Windows user per computer

segment.source: A MED-V workspace image can be used only by the Windows user who downloaded or imported the image.
segment.target: A MED-V workspace image can be used only by the Windows user who downloaded or imported the image.

segment.source: This user is the only user aside from administrators who have permissions to the folder where the downloaded images are located.
segment.target: This user is the only user aside from administrators who have permissions to the folder where the downloaded images are located.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Manually change the access control list (ACL) on the image store.
segment.target: Manually change the access control list (ACL) on the image store.

segment.source: When installing MED-V by using Configuration Manager with users rights enabled, uninstall fails
segment.target: When installing MED-V by using Configuration Manager with users rights enabled, uninstall fails

segment.source: If MED-V is installed by using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager and the run mode of the package is set to users rights, uninstall fails with an error message that says that only administrative users can uninstall MED-V.
segment.target: If MED-V is installed by using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager and the run mode of the package is set to users rights, uninstall fails with an error message that says that only administrative users can uninstall MED-V.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: When creating a Configuration Manager package for MED-V, set the run mode to administrative rights.
segment.target: When creating a Configuration Manager package for MED-V, set the run mode to administrative rights.

segment.source: When installing MED-V by using a corporate deployment system, where the installation is configured to run the client following installation, you cannot run the client
segment.target: When installing MED-V by using a corporate deployment system, where the installation is configured to run the client following installation, you cannot run the client

segment.source: If MED-V is installed by using a corporate deployment system and the installation package is configured to run MED-V client following the installation, after the client is running under the system account, you cannot see that the client is running (except in the notification area), and you cannot interact with it.
segment.target: If MED-V is installed by using a corporate deployment system and the installation package is configured to run MED-V client following the installation, after the client is running under the system account, you cannot see that the client is running (except in the notification area), and you cannot interact with it.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: When installing MED-V by using a corporate deployment system, use the STARTMEDV=0 .msi parameter.
segment.target: When installing MED-V by using a corporate deployment system, use the STARTMEDV=0 .msi parameter.

segment.source: MED-V test image fails to start
segment.target: MED-V test image fails to start

segment.source: If a MED-V test image fails to start, it will never recover and all future startups will fail with a “GINA fail to load” error message.
segment.target: If a MED-V test image fails to start, it will never recover and all future startups will fail with a “GINA fail to load” error message.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Delete the existing test image and then re-create it.
segment.target: Delete the existing test image and then re-create it.

segment.source: After attempting to join a domain with the wrong credentials, the image never succeeds in joining the domain
segment.target: After attempting to join a domain with the wrong credentials, the image never succeeds in joining the domain

segment.source: If there is a configuration error in the join domain building block, which is part of the virtual machine first-time setup script, it causes the MED-V workspace to fail when attempting to join a domain.
segment.target: If there is a configuration error in the join domain building block, which is part of the virtual machine first-time setup script, it causes the MED-V workspace to fail when attempting to join a domain.

segment.source: After the configuration error is repaired, the image included in the MED-V workspace cannot join the domain.
segment.target: After the configuration error is repaired, the image included in the MED-V workspace cannot join the domain.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: If the image was deployed, redistribute the image.
segment.target: If the image was deployed, redistribute the image.

segment.source: If the image was a test image, re-create the image.
segment.target: If the image was a test image, re-create the image.

segment.source: MED-V does not support multiple monitors
segment.target: MED-V does not support multiple monitors

segment.source: MED-V does not support displaying published applications across multiple monitors.
segment.target: MED-V does not support displaying published applications across multiple monitors.

segment.source: Published applications and other client windows may be displayed in the wrong screen, and sometimes after a screen is disconnected, MED-V attempts to send the screen to the monitor so that the connected monitor appears blank.
segment.target: Published applications and other client windows may be displayed in the wrong screen, and sometimes after a screen is disconnected, MED-V attempts to send the screen to the monitor so that the connected monitor appears blank.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Disconnect the additional screen, and restart the client.
segment.target: Disconnect the additional screen, and restart the client.

segment.source: MED-V workspace might fail to start if the host crashes during MED-V workspace startup
segment.target: MED-V workspace might fail to start if the host crashes during MED-V workspace startup

segment.source: If the host crashes during the MED-V workspace startup process and an error message appears that says “Root element is missing,” the MED-V workspace might add data to an empty virtual machine configuration (VMC) file, which will cause the startup process to fail.
segment.target: If the host crashes during the MED-V workspace startup process and an error message appears that says “Root element is missing,” the MED-V workspace might add data to an empty virtual machine configuration (VMC) file, which will cause the startup process to fail.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Replace the empty VMC file with a VMC file from the base image.
segment.target: Replace the empty VMC file with a VMC file from the base image.

segment.source: The keyboard does not respond in published application windows
segment.target: The keyboard does not respond in published application windows

segment.source: In a MED-V workspace, if you press the Windows logo key when a published application is in focus, the keyboard no longer responds in published application windows.
segment.target: In a MED-V workspace, if you press the Windows logo key when a published application is in focus, the keyboard no longer responds in published application windows.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Press the Windows logo key while a published application is in focus.
segment.target: Press the Windows logo key while a published application is in focus.

segment.source: A domain MED-V workspace does not update domain credentials
segment.target: A domain MED-V workspace does not update domain credentials

segment.source: When using a persistent MED-V workspace in a domain environment, if you change your domain password, the MED-V client does not update the MED-V workspace domain credentials.
segment.target: When using a persistent MED-V workspace in a domain environment, if you change your domain password, the MED-V client does not update the MED-V workspace domain credentials.

segment.source: When a published application attempts to access a network resource, you will receive an error message notifying you that your credentials expired.
segment.target: When a published application attempts to access a network resource, you will receive an error message notifying you that your credentials expired.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Restart the MED-V workspace operating system.
segment.target: Restart the MED-V workspace operating system.

segment.source: Maximized published application windows cover the host taskbar
segment.target: Maximized published application windows cover the host taskbar

segment.source: If you maximize a published application window to full screen, it might cover the host taskbar.
segment.target: If you maximize a published application window to full screen, it might cover the host taskbar.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: Minimize the published application window to gain access to the notification area, and restart the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Minimize the published application window to gain access to the notification area, and restart the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Minimize the published application window, and then restore the window to its maximized state.
segment.target: Minimize the published application window, and then restore the window to its maximized state.

segment.source: Adding users or groups in the MED-V Server Configuration Manager does not work
segment.target: Adding users or groups in the MED-V Server Configuration Manager does not work

segment.source: When adding users or groups in the Select Users or Groups dialog box, the selected users or groups are not added to the access control list in the MED-V Server Configuration Manager.
segment.target: When adding users or groups in the Select Users or Groups dialog box, the selected users or groups are not added to the access control list in the MED-V Server Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Add users or groups using the Enter User or Group names dialog box.
segment.target: Add users or groups using the Enter User or Group names dialog box.

segment.source: For detailed information, see How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component.
segment.target: For detailed information, see How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component.

segment.source: MED-V does not work on computers with Windows Virtual PC for Windows 7 installed
segment.target: MED-V does not work on computers with Windows Virtual PC for Windows 7 installed

segment.source: MED-V requires Windows Virtual PC 2007.
segment.target: MED-V requires Windows Virtual PC 2007.

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC for Windows 7 and Virtual PC 2007 SP1 cannot be installed on the same computer.
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC for Windows 7 and Virtual PC 2007 SP1 cannot be installed on the same computer.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Uninstall Virtual PC for Windows 7 before installing Virtual PC 2007 SP1 and MED-V.
segment.target: Uninstall Virtual PC for Windows 7 before installing Virtual PC 2007 SP1 and MED-V.

segment.source: MED-V does not support Virtual PC and Windows XP Mode images
segment.target: MED-V does not support Virtual PC and Windows XP Mode images

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP1 does not support images created by Windows Virtual PC for Windows 7.
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP1 does not support images created by Windows Virtual PC for Windows 7.

segment.source: If a Virtual PC for Windows 7 image is used, the client will fail during startup.
segment.target: If a Virtual PC for Windows 7 image is used, the client will fail during startup.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Create MED-V images by using Virtual PC 2007 SP1.
segment.target: Create MED-V images by using Virtual PC 2007 SP1.

segment.source: Windows firewall blocks Virtual PC 2007 SP1 network activity
segment.target: Windows firewall blocks Virtual PC 2007 SP1 network activity

segment.source: By default, Windows firewall blocks Virtual PC 2007 SP1 network activity, and when Virtual PC 2007 SP1 initiates on the client computer, there is a firewall message that blocks its startup sequence and all network access.
segment.target: By default, Windows firewall blocks Virtual PC 2007 SP1 network activity, and when Virtual PC 2007 SP1 initiates on the client computer, there is a firewall message that blocks its startup sequence and all network access.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Update the firewall exception by using Group Policy before MED-V is used by the end user.
segment.target: Update the firewall exception by using Group Policy before MED-V is used by the end user.

segment.source: When upgrading the client an error message appears
segment.target: When upgrading the client an error message appears

segment.source: When upgrading the client from MED-V 1.0 to MED-V 1.0 SP1, a message may appear notifying you that no MED-V workspace is defined.
segment.target: When upgrading the client from MED-V 1.0 to MED-V 1.0 SP1, a message may appear notifying you that no MED-V workspace is defined.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Close the client and restart it.
segment.target: Close the client and restart it.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 Release Notes

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes
